alert.note: Alert for Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 2:07AM CST until January 04 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Alabama and southwest Alabama, including the following counties, in south central Alabama, Monroe and Wilcox. In southwest Alabama, Clarke, Mobile and Washington. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 205 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. So far, between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen over portions of the advisory area in a short amount of time. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Thomasville, Citronelle, Camden, Grove Hill, Leroy, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Deer Park, Whatley, Tibbie, Pine Hill, Calvert, Fruitdale, Vredenburgh, Fulton, McIntosh, Yellow Bluff, Suggsville and Toddtown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
